intro: Disperma parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered disperma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
